docs.text: in one scene from " the people vs .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: larry flynt , " the hustler magazine publisher appears at a self-staged free speech rally .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as graphic photos flash on a huge screen behind him , flynt strides confidently across the stage , delivering a rousing speech over what really constitutes obscenity .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the spectacle was reminiscent of the scene in " patton " where the general spoke in front of a giant american flag .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: both scenes were stirring , larger than life , richly entertaining , and felt totally like contrived set pieces for big hollywood movies .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: overall , that sums up " the people vs .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: larry flynt . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film is a wildly entertaining hoot which , despite being based on fact , feels like a big , phony hollywood movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the son of a kentucky moonshiner , flynt ( woody harrelson ) ran away from home and ended up operating strip clubs in cincinnati .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there he met althea leasure ( courtney love ) , a bisexual stripper who became his fourth wife and the love of his life .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: to bolster interest in his clubs , he started a sexually explicit newsletter that grew into hustler magazine .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: flynt , along with the magazine's rag-tag management team , headed by his brother jimmy ( played nicely by woody's real-life brother , steak & shake commercial veteran brett harrelson ) , viewed playboy magazine with contempt .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they mocked its slick articles and airbrushed photos , striving to keep hustler focused on " what guys really want , " explicit photos that would make a gynecologist squirm , and extremely crude humor .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film's prime example of hustler's attitude is a cartoon depicting characters from the wizard of oz in an orgy , giving the audience an opportunity to giggle at flynt's " naughtiness . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: director milos forman conveniently ignores the magazine's frequent attempts to derive humor from child molestation , racism , and endless scatological cartoons .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: flynt's rag labored in well-deserved obscurity until he published nude photos of jacqueline onassis , which brought the magazine international attention , big money and the attention of conservatives .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: an obscenity bust followed , the first in a long series of battles between flynt and the law .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: lawyer alan isaacman ( edward norton ) enters the scene , hired by flynt's wife .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: norton , an exceptional actor , is wonderful as the beleaguered lawyer trying to navigate the legal system while dealing with flynt's increasingly childish and bizarre behavior .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in court , we meet the sputtering conservatives , headed by citizens for decency leader charles keating ( james cromwell . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as keating blathers about flynt's immorality , the camera slowly moves in for a close-up of his name tag , inviting the audience to gloat at the notion of morality being trumpeted by keating , who was later convicted in a $2 billion s&l fraud .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: flynt's other prime foe is rev . jerry falwell , who sues over a hustler parody involving him and his mother having sex in an outhouse .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: tragedy strikes as flynt is shot by a would-be assassin , leaving him paralyzed from the waist down .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a dark period follows , as flynt and leasure hole up in an l . a . suite , strung out on pain killers .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: flynt eventually kicks drugs , but leasure succumbs to addiction , and later , aids .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after watch falwell on tv , describing aids as a punishment from god , flynt directs his lawyer to take the falwell case to the supreme court , leading to the film's climactic courtroom scene .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " the people vs , larry flynt " is at its weakest when moralizing on free speech and lionizing flynt .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " if they'll protect a scumbag like me , then they'll protect all of you , " declared flynt .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he's right , of course , but the director forman cheats in portraying the opposition as little more than hypocritical buffoons .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he also cheats in casting woody harrelson as flynt .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: harrelson is an attractive , charismatic man , and his strong performance paints flynt as a colorful folk hero .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: even a cursory look at the real flynt , who is making the talk show circuit , and plays the judge in an early courtroom scene , shows a bloated , morose and bitter man .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: an accurate portrayal of flynt would have made a more difficult film to watch , but a richer one .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: despite its flaws , " flynt " is a fast moving , rousing movie with some terrific acting , especially by courtney love , whose vibrant performance will likely garner an oscar nod .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the story may be candy-coated , but it's still delicious candy .
docs.label: positive
